title: Tule Lake Unit: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Tule Lake Unit  is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Circle of Discovery  Circle of Discovery parks of northern California and southern Oregon include Redwood National and State Parks, Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve, Crater Lake National Park, Lava Beds National Monument, Tule Lake Unit, Lassen Volcanic National Park, and Whiskeytown National Recreation Area. Read more   Tule Lake Segregation Center Jail  With a ranger-guided tour, visitors at the Tule Lake Unit can walk inside the Tule Lake Segregation Center jail, which still stands seventy years after its use. Visitors can see the layout of this WWII jail, stand inside one of the six cells, discover historic graffiti written by Japanese Americans who were incarcerated at the site, and gain a deeper understanding of this relatively unknown civil rights story. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.
